edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Hero

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Actor
      • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Hero

  • public class Hero
extends Actor
    The Hero is the focal point of a game. While it is technically possible to have many heroes, or invisible heroes that exist just so that the player has to keep bad things from happening to the hero, it is usually the case that a game has one hero who moves around on the screen, possibly jumping and crawling.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hero

        protected Hero(float width,
               float height,
               java.lang.String imgName)
        Construct a Hero by creating an Actor and incrementing the number of heroes created. This code should never be called directly by the game designer.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the hero
        height - The height of the hero
        imgName - The name of the file that has the default image for this hero

      • render

        public void render(SpriteBatch sb,
                   float delta)
        We can't just use the basic Actor renderer, because we might need to adjust a one-off animation (invincibility or throw) first
        Overrides:
        render in class Actor
        Parameters:
        sb - The SpriteBatch to use for drawing this hero
        delta - The time since the last render

      • getStrength

        public int getStrength()
        Return the hero's strength, in case it is useful to callback code
        Returns:
        The strength of the hero

      • setStrength

        public void setStrength(int amount)
        Give the hero more strength than the default, so it can survive more collisions with enemies. Note that calling this will not run any strength change callbacks... they only run in conjunction with collisions with goodies or enemies.
        Parameters:
        amount - The new strength of the hero

      • setTouchAndGo

        public void setTouchAndGo(float x,
                          float y)
        Indicate that upon a touch, this hero should begin moving with a specific velocity
        Parameters:
        x - Velocity in X dimension
        y - Velocity in Y dimension
